solid.notes: Ships from Japan.
Never Summer categorizes their ultrawide boards as "DF", or Drag Free.

splitboards.notes: Technically, the Split Bean snowboard has a 28.1cm waist, but at 144cm long it's much too short for most big foot riders. Otherwise, the maximum is 26.9.

solid.notes: Capita has their normal Men's and Women's lines, but they also have a separate line of snowboards 'Spring Break'. Their normal line maxes out at 27.4cm waist width.
Ships from Germany.
Winterstick will customize the width of your board for $100 more.

splitboards.notes: Winterstick will customize the width of your board for $100 more. All their standard boards are also available in split.

solid.notes: Telos lists their snowboard specs on this page.
It seems that currently (2020-09-17) that Bataleon has removed their website in anticipation of refresh for 2020-2021. The boards below were listed as of 2020-09-09.

splitboards.notes: Bataleon has not listed their 2020-2021 lineup yet.

solid.notes: Nitro makes the 28cm wide Pow board, but at 154cm it's too short for this list. They also make the Magnum designed for big foot riders with a pretty tight sidecut, but they only list the waist width (27.4cm) and not the presumably much larger underfoot size.

Prior has the Thruster 149XCE with a 28cm waist but it's extreme shortness makes it unsuitable for large riders. Prior also does custom boards but their online web order form does not let you choose a custom width. If interested, please contact them.

splitboards.notes: Technically, the XV Sushi snowboard has a 27.6cm waist, but at 145cm long it's much too short for most big foot riders. Otherwise, the maximum is 26.2cm.

solid.notes: Yes has several boards that are 26.8cm. Their Pro20 is 28.6cm (one of the widest available!), but the extreme shortness makes it unsuitable for larger riders.
Due to the specialty nature of these boards they're at the end of the list.
LTB makes the biggest boards around, but ship direct from manufacturer and delivers to the EU only. Since there's no US delivery I'm putting it at the end of the list.
Donek does custom snowboards, so you can get essentially anything you like. Expect to spend quite a bit more for a nice board though.

splitboards.notes: Donek does custom snowboards, so you can probably get them to make you a splitboard.

solid.notes: Custom snowboards made on Vancouver Island.
Custom snowboards made in New Zealand.

splitboards.notes: Custom snowboards made in New Zealand.

solid.notes: Franco makes very custom boards. You'll need to contact them for details.
Rome has not released their 2020-2021 line yet.

splitboards.notes: Rome has not released their 2020-2021 line yet.

solid.notes: Venture Snowboards has not released their 2020-2021 line yet.

splitboards.notes: Venture Snowboards has not released their 2020-2021 line yet.

solid.notes: Lobster Snowboards have not released their 2020-2021 line yet.

splitboards.notes: Lobster Snowboards have not released their 2020-2021 line yet.

solid.notes: Northwave has not released their 2020-2021 line yet.

splitboards.notes: Northwave has not released their 2020-2021 line yet.

solid.notes: Habitual Snowboard Co. just released their website, but it seems that links to specific boards don't work yet.

splitboards.notes: Habitual Snowboard Co. just released their website, but it seems that links to specific boards don't work yet.

solid.notes: Chomonix doesn't list specs of their snowboards, so we don't know the waist widths.

splitboards.notes: Chomonix doesn't list specs of their snowboards, so we don't know the waist widths. They make one split model, the Route.

solid.notes: Still working on their English site. Made in Germany.

splitboards.notes: Still working on their English site. Made in Germany.

solid.notes: Voile only makes splitboards, no traditional snowboards.

splitboards.notes: Voile's maximum width is 26.5cm. Note that they also sell DIY conversion kits.
